intro: Anisopappus rogersii subsp. rogersii, commonly known as the desert gourd, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The fruit is a hairy, elongated capsule that matures into a dry, spiny structure.
